home.title: Data Structure Playground
home.subtitle: A place to play with structures.
home.description: Just a handy tool to see how data structures actually look and behave.

avl-tree.name: AVL Tree
avl-tree.description: The first self-balancing BST where heights of two child subtrees of any node differ by at most one, ensuring stable O(log N) performance.

bloom-filter.name: Bloom Filter
bloom-filter.description: A space-efficient probabilistic structure used to test whether an element is a member of a set with zero false negatives.

min-max-heap.name: Min-Max Heap
min-max-heap.description: A complete binary tree providing constant-time access to both the minimum and maximum elements, ideal for double-ended priority queues.

deap.name: Double-Ended Heap (DEAP)
deap.description: A complete binary tree with an empty root, where the left subtree is a Min-Heap and the right is a Max-Heap, supporting efficient double-ended operations.

smmh.name: Symmetric Min-Max Heap (SMMH)
smmh.description: SMMH implements a highly efficient double-ended priority queue by maintaining symmetric order properties between sibling nodes.

binomial-heap.name: Binomial Heap
binomial-heap.description: A collection of binomial trees that supports standard heap operations plus ultra-fast merging of two heaps in logarithmic time.

fibonacci-heap.name: Fibonacci Heap
fibonacci-heap.description: A priority queue data structure with superior amortized time complexity, key to optimizing Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm.

b-tree.name: B-Tree
b-tree.description: A multi-way self-balancing tree optimized for storage systems, minimizing disk I/O for large-scale data reading and writing.

b-plus-tree.name: B+ Tree
b-plus-tree.description: A variation of B-Tree where all data resides in leaves, enabling better range queries and sequential access—the backbone of modern databases.

red-black-tree.name: Red-Black Tree
red-black-tree.description: A classic balanced BST using node coloring and rotations, widely used in systems like C++ STL maps and Java's TreeMap.

trie.name: Trie
trie.description: A prefix tree designed for efficient retrieval of keys in a set of strings, commonly used in search engine autocomplete and spell checkers.

patricia-trie.name: Patricia Trie
patricia-trie.description: A space-optimized Trie that compacts nodes with only one child, significantly reducing memory footprint for sparse datasets.
